summary: In 2020, to address a decline in audit rates for the highest-income taxpayers, the Department of the Treasury directed IRS to audit at least 8% of tax returns filed by individuals with income of $10 million or more. While IRS has increased the number of these audits, IRS still needs to assess its: Research efforts to understand the complexity of high-income returns Audit selection models...
title: Tax Compliance: Opportunities Exist to Improve IRS High-Income/High-Wealth Audits
